remarks: In an algebraic closure system, if ` S ` and ` T ` have the same closure and ` S ` is infinite independent, then ` T ` dominates ` S ` .  This follows from applying ~ acsinfd and then applying ~ unirnfdomd to the map given in ~ acsmap2d .  See Section II.5 in [Cohn] p. 81 to 82. (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
statement:
acsmap2d.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( ACS ` X ) ) $.
acsmap2d.2 $e |- N = ( mrCls ` A ) $.
acsmap2d.3 $e |- I = ( mrInd ` A ) $.
acsmap2d.4 $e |- ( ph -> S e. I ) $.
acsmap2d.5 $e |- ( ph -> T C_ X ) $.
acsmap2d.6 $e |- ( ph -> ( N ` S ) = ( N ` T ) ) $.
acsinfd.7 $e |- ( ph -> -. S e. Fin ) $.
acsdomd $p |- ( ph -> S ~<_ T ) $.
